result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M Alvarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Get his GED.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with any co-actors.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

Case 15CM2334 was dismissed and read into: 15CM1926.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas M Alvarez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Hearing at 04-04-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Thomas M Alvarez in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict for Kelsey Morin.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addressed the non-compliance letter from WCS. State is requesting cash bail be set. Defense objects. Court does not raise the bail, but does admonish the defendant, but does order him to go to WCS after court. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment. Court grants. Defense counsel to file possible Motion.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   Defendant Thomas M Alvarez did not appear.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. There if a offer and defense counsel would like this matter to tag along with the other file. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas M Alvarez in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant would like some time to go to the public defender's office. Court adjourns for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
